Hr* Raymond D* Hurlbert, Page 2, Match 18, 1999
This 1900*00 you could use in any way you see fit, including
bringing Elisabeth Marshall dam* On the basis of reactions
to her presentation at Purdue, some of thoee Bill and I hare
talked to raise the question as to whether this would be
worth the 1100*00 to $200*00 it would cost to bring her in*
I also raise the question of whether she would contribute to
a mar© crowded agenda than would result in the brisk meeting
you want* I’ve not seen her materials, and you have, so
we’ll leave to you.
Bill and I will either chat informally as needed (on a panel),
or make brief talks and/or remarks as we did at Region HI
recently. In which we talked about services and directions
for the NAEB, with emphasis by Bill on development as a
Professional Association* We1!! be glad to be fitted in any
way you see fit — since neither of us Is sensitive on this.
I hope this dees it, Raymond. Tour schedule looks fine and
we’ll both plan to arrive the early evening or afternoon of
April 17.
I wish we were richer* But with Engar and other Chairmen
pleading fear funds, our reserves are fast becoming thin,
and we’re trying to be as fair, all around, as we can.
Most sincerely.
Harry J. Skomia
